headline.main: Obama Legacy of Freeing Prisoners May Come Under Trump Siege
headline.print_headline: Trump May Reverse Obama Policy of Freeing Inmates

docs.lead_paragraph: The president has focused on getting criminal offenders out of jail early and trying to give them the skills to stay out, but the new administration has a law-and-order cast.

headline.main: Exclusive: U.S. Arrests Mexican Immigrant in Seattle Covered by Obama Program
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: U.S. Arrests Mexican Immigrant in Seattle Covered by Obama Program

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. authorities have arrested an immigrant from Mexico who was brought to the United States illegally as a child and later given a work permit during the Obama administration in what could be the first detention of its kind under President Donald Trump.

headline.main: Kremlin Counts Days to Trump's Inauguration, Blasts Obama
headline.print_headline: Kremlin Counts Days to Trump's Inauguration, Blasts Obama

docs.lead_paragraph: With eager anticipation, the Kremlin is counting the days to Donald Trump's inauguration and venting its anger at Barack Obama's outgoing administration, no holds barred.

headline.main: Source: Obama DOJ Won't Push Antitrust Case Against Airlines
headline.print_headline: Source: Obama DOJ Won't Push Antitrust Case Against Airlines

docs.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department, which started investigating alleged collusion between the nation's major airlines in mid-2015, will not bring an antitrust case against the carriers before the Obama administration leaves office at the end of next week, according to a person familiar with the situation.

headline.main: What an Extra $86,824 Gets a Reporter on an Obama Trip

docs.abstract: White House reporters who went on President Obama’s trip to China, Myanmar and Australia last month were in for a surprise when they saw the bill: For example, a trip that was estimated to cost The New York Times an eye-popping $60,000 wound up costing $92,111. We thought we’d see whether we could make the same trip flying commercially, and determine how much money could be saved.

headline.main: City May Get $3.4 Billion From Federal Stimulus Bill
headline.print_headline: City May Get $3.4 Billion From Federal Stimulus Bill

docs.lead_paragraph: New York City’s slice of the package could include $1.8 billion in Medicaid savings and at least $1.6 billion in education aid, officials said on Sunday night.

headline.seo: With Economic Stimulus on Horizon, Westchester Projects Vie for Dollars
headline.main: With Stimulus on Horizon, Race Begins
headline.sub: Westchester Competing With the Rest New York  To Finance Myriad Projects ;
headline.print_headline: With Stimulus On Horizon, Race Begins

headline.seo: Federal Stimulus Plan Could Help Shrink New York State’s Deficit

headline.print_headline: Federal Stimulus Package Could Help Shrink State’s Vast Budget Gap

byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes, David M. Herszenhorn and Colin Moynihan contributed reporting.
